1.text:
==================================================

emberx-select

==================================================

What

Dropdown <select> element.

Where

https://www.npmjs.com/package/emberx-select

Install

$ cd projectDir

$ ember install emberx-select

Restart ember s

Examples

Select a page/route.

router.js:

Router.map(function() {

  this.route('employees', {path: '/employees/:name'});

});

templates/application.hbs

{{#x-select value=selectedEmployee action='submitSelections' as |e|}}

  <option selected='selected'>Employee</option>

  <option value='all'>All</option>

  {{#each employees as |employee|}}

    {{#e.option value=employee}}{{employee}}{{/e.option}}

  {{/each}}

{{/x-select}}

{{outlet}}

templates/employees.hbs

<h1>Employee: {{model.name}}</h1>
1.title: Dropdown select

-Keh3jlg1YnZQTgXKe6k.title: Collapsible Panel

-KehF40SxlqmHa14yqLY.text:
==================================================

Bind Controller Property to Another Controller

==================================================

What

Bind and make available a property from one controller to another controller and it's template.

Consider using a service as an alternative.

Examples

controllers/application.js

export default Ember.Controller.extend({
  ppsAll: Ember.computed.mapBy('model', 'pp'),
  pps: Ember.computed.uniq('ppsAll'),
});

controllers/employees.js

export default Ember.Controller.extend({
  applicationController: Ember.inject.controller('application'),
  pps: Ember.computed.alias('applicationController.pps'),
});

templates/employees.hbs

{{pps}}
-KehF40SxlqmHa14yqLY.title: Bind other controller properties

-KehFMJCP0_jMtLveY1N.text:
==================================================

Create a New Ember App

==================================================

Ensure all dependencies are installed: node, ember-cli, bower, (phantomjs, & watchman)

$ brew update

$ node -v          // must be >0.12. Install LTS from https://nodejs.org/en/

$ npm -v          // must be >0.12

$ bower -v        // $ npm install -g bower  // Required sudo on the macbook pro.

 

$ npm install -g n    // n is a node version manager. Required sudo on the macbook pro.

$ n lts                    // installs and activates node lts version

$ n                        // shows available and active node versions

 

$ npm install -g ember-cli

$ npm install -g bower

$ npm install -g phantomjs           // headless browser used to automate and test webpages

$ brew install -g watchman

Edit hosts file

$ vimhosts

Create New Ember App

$ cd to parent dir

$ ember new new-app-name

$ ctrl-t           // open new terminal tab

$ cd new-app-name

$ ember s      // start ember server

In browser goto http://local.new-app-name:4200  or  http://localhost:4200, should see a welcome page.

Delete Welcome Page & Set Up Application Template

$ ctrl-c          // stop server

Open new-app-name folder in Atom.

Edit package.json by removing: "ember-welcome-page": "^1.0.3",

$ npm prune

$ ember s

Goto other terminal window.

$ ember g template application

In Atom, add some text to: app/templates/application.hbs

Refresh browser and should see new text.
-KehFMJCP0_jMtLveY1N.title: Install and create new ember app

-KehFcG7M1YnIY1_pVbq.text:
==================================================

Connect App to Firebase

==================================================

Add emberfire to app

$ ember install emberfire

Set up db

Goto Firebase: https://console.firebase.google.com/

Click "Create New Project" and type new-app-name.

Click on "Database", then "Rules", and set: ".read": true, ".write": true

Click "Publish" and "Dismiss".

Click "Data", then the green plus sign to add data.  Add test data ... see below.

Click "Overview", then "Add Firebase to your web app" and click "Copy".

Link app to firebase 

In Atom, open: config/environment.js

Add a `firebase: { ... },` property to `var ENV = { .. }`

In the `firebase` property paste the copied info and delete everything except content of `var = config { ... }`.

  firebase: {
     apiKey: "AIzaSyB-...",
     authDomain: "new-app-name.firebaseapp.com",
     databaseURL: "https://new-app-name.firebaseio.com",
     storageBucket: "new-app-name.appspot.com",
     messagingSenderId: "3222111111709"
   },

 Test connection

Restart ember s

Save the following to a `data.json` file and import it into fb db:

{
  "tests" : [ {
    "name" : "Test 1"
  }, {
    "name" : ".. 2"
  }, {
    "name" : ".. and 3 ... done!"
  } ]
}

$ ember g model test

Edit app/model/test.js:

import DS from 'ember-data';

export default DS.Model.extend({
 name: DS.attr('string'),
});

$ ember g route application

Edit app/templates/application.hbs: 

{{#each model as |test|}}
 {{test.name}}
{{/each}}

Edit app/routes/application.js:

import Ember from 'ember';

export default Ember.Route.extend({
 model() {
   return this.store.findAll('test');
 }
});

The app in the browser should say: "Test 1 .. 2 .. and 3 ... done!"

$ ember d model test
-KehFcG7M1YnIY1_pVbq.title: Connect Ember App to Firebase

-KehFmvqzK8vSNHhFcUV.text:
==================================================

Add Sass

==================================================

What

Add the ability to compile .scss to .css.

Where

https://www.npmjs.com/package/ember-cli-sass

Install

$ ember install ember-cli-sass

Rename `app/styles/app.css` to `.scss`.

Examples

By default compiles `app/style/app.scss` to `dist/assets/app.css`.

To add more files, use `sassOptions` ... see Usage at link above.
-KehFmvqzK8vSNHhFcUV.title: Add SASS to Ember

-KehFyXuuS73fGDjLz4v.text:
==================================================

Add jQuery UI's JS (only)

==================================================

What

Add jQ UI features.

Where

https://www.20papercups.net/programming/drag-n-drop-sorting-with-ember-2-x-and-jquery-ui/

http://jqueryui.com/

Consider: ember-cli-jquery-ui https://www.npmjs.com/package/ember-cli-jquery-ui

Install

Install jQ-UI

$ cd projectDir

$ bower install --save jqueryui     // installs jqueryui for project

Edit app/ember-cli-build.js:

app.import('bower_components/jquery-ui/jquery-ui.js');

Restart ember server

Make a list sortable and persist data to server

Model must an attribute on which to sort. Eg. `position: DS.attr('number'),`

The table or list HTMLbars upon which jQ-ui's Sortable will act must go in a component and not a template. Because the table has to be inserted into the DOM before Sortable is called so it has a hook to grab.

Add `class="sortable"` to list's wrapping element: <ol> <ul> <div> <tbody>.

<div class="container sortable">
 {{#each model.tiles as |tile|}}
   <div class="tile" data-id="{{tile.id}}">
     <div class="hover">
       {{tile-content model=model tile=tile}}
     </div>
   </div>
 {{/each}}
</div>

Edit the component's js file to look like this:

export default Ember.Component.extend({
  didInsertElement: function() {
    let component = this;
    Ember.$('.sortable').sortable({
      update: function() {
        let indices = {};
        $(this).children().each( (index, item) => {
          indices[$(item).data('id')] = index + 1;
        });
        component.updateSortedOrder(indices);
      }
    });
    Ember.$('.sortable').disableSelection();
  },
  updateSortedOrder(indices) {
    this.beginPropertyChanges();
    this.get('model.tiles').forEach((tile) => {
      var position = indices[tile.get('id')];
      if (tile.get('position') !== position) {
        tile.set('position',position);
        tile.save();
      }
    });
    this.endPropertyChanges();
  },
}); 

Examples

See links above.
-KehFyXuuS73fGDjLz4v.title: Add jQueryUI JS to an Ember app

-KehGAmqUxx8uQZuIaUZ.text:
==================================================

Add Modals

==================================================

What

Display information or forms in a pop-up modal.

(Could use jqueryUI's modal, but requires initialization, and destruction to prevent memory leaks.)

Where

https://www.npmjs.com/package/ember-modal-dialog

Install

$ ember install ember-modal-dialog

$ ember install ember-cli-sass     // If not already installed.

Restart ember s

Edit `styles/app.scss`:

@import "ember-modal-dialog/ember-modal-structure";
@import "ember-modal-dialog/ember-modal-appearance";

Examples

In template .hbs file add:

<button {{action "toggleModal"}}>Toggle Modal</button>
{{#if isShowingModal}}
 {{#modal-dialog close="toggleModal"
                 targetAttachment="center"
                 translucentOverlay=true}}
   Oh hai there!
 {{/modal-dialog}}
{{/if}}

In controller .js file add:

isShowingModal: false,
actions: {
  toggleModal: function() {
    this.toggleProperty('isShowingModal');
  }
}
-KehGAmqUxx8uQZuIaUZ.title: Add Modals to an Ember app

-KehGLpWSLl9arUd5VEG.text:
==================================================

Add jQuery UI's icons

==================================================

What

These notes are not complete. These are just hints on how to possibly get started.

Where

http://jqueryui.com/

Consider: ember-cli-jquery-ui https://www.npmjs.com/package/ember-cli-jquery-ui

Install

$ cd projectDir

$ bower install --save jqueryui     // installs jqueryui for project

Edit `app/ember-cli-build.js`:

app.import('bower_components/jquery-ui/jquery-ui.js');
// for jQ-ui's js

app.import('bower_components/jquery-ui/themes/base/jquery-ui.css');
// This should add jQ-ui's base .css which contains .ui-icon definitions.

Need to import the images somehow:

Might have to add an import line to `app/ember-cli-build.js`.

Might have to copy `bower_components/jquery-ui/themes/base/images` to `public/assets/images`

Restart ember server

Usage

Should be able to use `<span class="ui-icon ui-icon-pencil"></span>` in .hbs files now.
-KehGLpWSLl9arUd5VEG.title: Add jQueryUI Icons to Ember

-KehGZJ53Ycj06U4RJ8q.text:
==================================================

Add Font Awesome

==================================================

What

Install and use font awesome.

Where

https://www.npmjs.com/package/ember-font-awesome

http://fontawesome.io/icons/

http://fontawesome.io/examples/

Install

$ ember install ember-font-awesome

If using `ember-cli-sass` or `ember-cli-less`:

Edit `ember-cli-build.js`:

var app = new EmberApp({
'ember-font-awesome': {
  useScss: true, // for ember-cli-sass
  useLess: true  // for ember-cli-less
 }
});

Edit `app/styles/app.scss`:

@import "font-awesome";

Restart ember s

Usage

{{fa-icon "camera"}}

See links above for many more options.
-KehGZJ53Ycj06U4RJ8q.title: Add Fontawesome to Ember

-KehH-Mq2dtGgdkyDVC0.text:
==================================================

Sort Data Model

==================================================

What

Sort a model by an attribute.

Where

http://emberjs.com/api/classes/Ember.computed.html#method_sort

How

Add to controller or component js file:

positionSorting: ['position'],
tilesByPosition: Ember.computed.sort('model.tiles', 'positionSorting'),

 In .hbs file, call `tilesByPosition` instead of `model.tiles`.
-KehH-Mq2dtGgdkyDVC0.title: Sort Model Data in Ember

-KehH8qesMDi87RZIr4h.text:
==================================================

Form Validation

==================================================

What

Add validations for form inputs.

Where

https://www.npmjs.com/package/ember-cp-validations

http://offirgolan.github.io/ember-cp-validations/docs/modules/Usage.html

Install

$ ember install ember-cp-validations

Basic Usage

In Models:

1. Build validation rules in models/xxx.js:

import Ember from 'ember';
import DS from 'ember-data';
import { validator, buildValidations } from 'ember-cp-validations';

const Validations = buildValidations({
 username: validator('presence', true),
 password: [
   validator('presence', true),
   validator('length', { min: 4, max: 8 })
 ],
 email: [
   validator('presence', true),
   validator('format', { type: 'email' })
 ],
 emailConfirmation: [
   validator('presence', true),
   validator('confirmation', {
     on: 'email',
     message: '{description} do not match',
     description: 'Email addresses'
   })
 ],
url: [
   validator('format', { type: 'url', allowBlank: true })
 ]
});

2. Add to model in models/xxx.js:

export default DS.Model.extend(Validations, {
 'username': attr('string'),
 'password': attr('string'),
 'email': attr('string')
});

In Objects, like components:

See docs: http://offirgolan.github.io/ember-cp-validations/docs/modules/Basic.html
-KehH8qesMDi87RZIr4h.title: Form Validation in Ember

-KehHHTQLpmtuHSWuYdA.text:
==================================================

Store Access from with a Component

==================================================

Examples

In components/xxx.js add:

export default Ember.Component.extend({
  store: Ember.inject.service(),
  this.get('store').createRecord('modelName', {
    title: newTitle
  }).save();
})
-KehHHTQLpmtuHSWuYdA.title: Store access from a component

-KehHRaMcMfqHsniABMR.text:
==================================================

Add Bootstrap

==================================================

What

Add bootstrap with native Ember components.

Where

https://www.npmjs.com/package/ember-bootstrap

http://www.ember-bootstrap.com/

Install

If you plan on using sass, first

$ ember install ember-cli-sass

Change `app.css` to `app.scss`.

$ ember install ember-bootstrap

To not use Bootstrap's icon font, edit `ember-cli-build.js`:

'ember-bootstrap': {
  'importBootstrapFont': false,
},

To only import specific assets, edit `app.scss`:

@import "ember-bootstrap/variables.scss";
@import "ember-bootstrap/mixins.scss";
@import "ember-bootstrap/normalize.scss";
@import "ember-bootstrap/scaffolding.scss";
@import "ember-bootstrap/type.scss";
@import "ember-bootstrap/buttons.scss";

Restart ember s

Examples

See: http://www.ember-bootstrap.com/#/components
-KehHRaMcMfqHsniABMR.title: Add Bootstrap to Ember

-KejDq1qDvSwGvAVRC8a.text:
Source: https://dockyard.com/blog/2014/04/28/dont-override-init

 

Do NOT do this:

var UsersController = Ember.ArrayController.extend({
  init: function() {
    // some custom stuff
  }
})
export default UsersController;

The call to `this._super();` was fogotten overriding the original `init` call.

 

DO THIS:

var UsersController = Ember.ArrayController.extend({
  doSomething: function() {
    // some custom stuff
  }.on('init')
})
export default UsersController;

 

The call to `.on('init')` fires `doSomething` when `init` is called.
-KejDq1qDvSwGvAVRC8a.title: Controller on init functions

-KekBVh6OOkrR5-HjaUr.text:
Sources

https://github.com/firebase/FirebaseUI-Web

https://gist.github.com/steven-ferguson/8eddf63123fa74066e9d92f7e829d8e9

https://guides.emberjs.com/v2.11.0/addons-and-dependencies/managing-dependencies/

 

Steps

Add to `app/index.html`:

<!-- FirebaseUI - https://github.com/firebase/FirebaseUI-Web -->
<script src="https://cdn.firebase.com/libs/firebaseui/1.0.0/firebaseui.js"></script>
<link type="text/css" rel="stylesheet" href="https://cdn.firebase.com/libs/firebaseui/1.0.0/firebaseui.css" />
<!-- // FirebaseUI -->

Add to `app/package.json`:

...
"devDependencies": {
  ...
  "firebaseui": "^1.0.0",
  ...
},

$ npm update

Add to `app/bower.json`:

...
"dependencies": {
    ...
    "firebaseui": "^1.0.0"
  }
...

$ bower update

Add to `ember-cli-build.js`:

app.import('bower_components/firebaseui/dist/firebaseui.js');
app.import('bower_components/firebaseui/dist/firebaseui.css');

$ ember g -> the `firebase-ui-auth.js` component, `login.hbs` template, and `login.js` controller and edit as found here:

https://gist.github.com/steven-ferguson/8eddf63123fa74066e9d92f7e829d8e9

 

Stopped here ... completely lost!
-KekBVh6OOkrR5-HjaUr.title: Add FirebaseUI to Ember for Auth

-Kep1VrTLbYS4RLHdYC9.text:
Source:

https://www.emberschool.com/course/3/154

 

Steps:

$ ember g model user

 

Edit `models/users.js`:

export default DS.Model.extend({

  displayName: DS.attr('string'),

  email: DS.attr('string'),

});

 

Add some users to Firebase.

 

$ ember g route login

 

Edit `routes/login.js`:

export default Ember.Route.extend({

  model() {

    return this.store.findAll('user');

  }

}); 

 

Add to `templates/login.hbs`:

{{#each model as |user|}}

  {{user.displayName}}

{{/each}}

 

$ ember g controller login

$ ember install ember-cookies 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Source:

https://www.emberscreencasts.com/posts/83-session-service

 

$ ember g service session

 

Edit `service/session.js`:

export default Ember.Service.extend({

  currentUser: null,

  login(user){

    this.set('currentUser', user);

  },

  logout(){

    this.set('currentUser', null);

  }

});
-Kep1VrTLbYS4RLHdYC9.title: Ember user session service

-KetTEd-JVvvPanMjusD.text:
Atom

Keyboard Shortcuts

https://github.com/nwinkler/atom-keyboard-shortcuts

https://gist.github.com/chrissimpkins/5bf5686bae86b8129bee

 

ctrl-shft-l          select language

cmd-ctrl-up      move line up/down with arrows

alt-shft-right    select by word right/left with arrows

cmd-k, arrow   slip pane in direction of arrow

ctrl-shft-up      insert multiple cursor above current

 

cmd-shft-p       command palette

cmd-p              project files palette

cmd-b              open files palette

cmd-r              open method

 

cmd-\              toggle tree-view

 

ctrl-shft-m       markdown preview, eg readme.md

 

-- below is linux not yet edited to mac (above)

ctrl-shft-b        changed files to commit palette

alt-\                focus tree-view

 

ctrl-shft-F2      toggle bookmark

ctrl-F2            bookmarks palette

F2                  goto next bookmark

shft-F2           goto prev bookmark

 

ctrl-shft-d       duplicate line

ctrl-shft-k       kills line

 

ctrl-del               delete to end of word

ctrl-backspace    delete to prev word

 

alt-shft-u/d        add cursor up/down

 

ctrl-m               goto matching brace

ctrl-alt-m          select all text in braces

 

alt-F3               select all text behind cursor or highlighted text

 

alt-shft-s          snippets palette

 

ctrl-alt-[/]        fold / unfold code block

 

ctrl-k               l/r opens new panel with current file copied

ctrl-k-l/r          moves focus l/r

 

Packages

alt-r Atom runner package

ctrl-alt-g Grunt runner - run

ctrl-alt-shft-g Grunt runner - stop

ctrl-alt-t Grunt runner - toggle log

ctrl-alt-shft-t Grunt runner - toggle panel

 

cmd pal: pig Pigment package

crtl-alt-c Color-picker

 

crtl-alt-b Beautify

crtl-alt-/ Aligner

 

ctrl-alt-o Git Control

ctrl-shft-h Git plus palette

alt-t Git time machine

 

Ember

ctrl-alt-e component/controller <-> template

ctrl-alt-r controller <-> route

 

Ruby on Rails

ctrl-r v f open-view-finder

ctrl-r v   open-view

ctrl-r l   open-layout

ctrl-r m   open-model

ctrl-r h   open-helper

ctrl-r t   open-test

ctrl-r s   open-spec

ctrl-r p   open-partial-template

ctrl-r a   open-asset

=loop tab each block

sync-settings package

gist: e35c7f636e0f0c8e200c4cd0744e388c

Command palette >> sync restore              # applies latest backup

 

wakatime

https://wakatime.com/dashboard

Api Key: d037ae6d-4c20-4b13-9e49-f28c25c17ce7

 

Beautify and linter-rubocop for Ruby require Rubocop

I already installed this in VBox setup for Linux, RoR ...

$ gem install -N rubocop

 

Git Control requires git-flow for flow controls to work

This is not installed in VBox setup for Linux, RoR ...

$ sudo apt-get install git-flow

 

Snippets

http://flight-manual.atom.io/using-atom/sections/snippets

alt-shft-s list all avail snippets

Custom Snippets: ~/.atom/snipppets.cson

 

'.source.js': # see language-javascript package scope value

  'if, else if, else': # name for snippet menu: alt-shft-s

    'prefix': 'ieie' # what's typed then tab to call the snippet

    'body': """ # the snippet text itself

      if (${1:true}) {

        $2

      } else if (${3:false}) {

        $4

      } else {

        $5

      }

    """

ctrl-r open method

 

ctrl-\ toggle tree-view

alt-\ focus tree-view

 

ctrl-shft-F2 toggle bookmark

ctrl-F2 bookmarks palette

F2 goto next bookmark

shft-F2 goto prev bookmark

 

ctrl-u/d move line up/down

ctrl-l/r move cursor one word l/r (shft to select)

 

ctrl-shft-d duplicate line

ctrl-shft-k kills line

 

ctrl-del delete to end of word

ctrl-backspace delete to prev word

 

alt-shft-u/d add cursor up/down

 

ctrl-m goto matching brace

ctrl-alt-m select all text in braces

 

alt-F3 select all text behind cursor or highlighted text

 

alt-shft-s snippets palette

 

ctrl-alt-[/] fold / unfold code block

 

ctrl-k l/r opens new panel with current file copied

ctrl-k-l/r moves focus l/r

 

 

Packages

alt-r Atom runner package

ctrl-alt-g Grunt runner - run

ctrl-alt-shft-g Grunt runner - stop

ctrl-alt-t Grunt runner - toggle log

ctrl-alt-shft-t Grunt runner - toggle panel

 

cmd pal: pig Pigment package

crtl-alt-c Color-picker

 

crtl-alt-b Beautify

crtl-alt-/ Aligner

 

ctrl-alt-o Git Control

ctrl-shft-h Git plus palette

alt-t Git time machine

 

Ember

ctrl-alt-e component/controller <-> template

ctrl-alt-r controller <-> route

 

Ruby on Rails

ctrl-r c   open-controller

ctrl-r v f open-view-finder

ctrl-r v   open-view

ctrl-r l   open-layout

ctrl-r m   open-model

ctrl-r h   open-helper

ctrl-r t   open-test

ctrl-r s   open-spec

ctrl-r p   open-partial-template

ctrl-r a   open-asset

ctrl-r d m open-migration-finder

ctrl-r f open-factory

 

ctrl-shft-> erb blocks <%= %> type initials for others: fsf

=loop tab each block

 

ctrl-. key binding resolver
